karate.gml.description: Zachary's Karate Club network (1977). This dataset represents social interactions among 34 members of a university karate club. It is widely used in studies of community detection and network modularity.
karate.gml.citation: Zachary, W. W. (1977). An Information Flow Model for Conflict and Fission in Small Groups. Journal of Anthropological Research, 33(4), 452–473.

lesmis.gml.description: Character co-occurrence network from Victor Hugo's novel 'Les Misérables'. Nodes represent characters, and edges indicate joint appearances in chapters. Frequently used for testing graph visualization algorithms.
lesmis.gml.citation: Knuth, D. E. (1993). The Stanford GraphBase: A Platform for Combinatorial Computing.

ba_scale_free.gml.description: Synthetic scale-free network generated using the Barabási–Albert preferential attachment model. The network exhibits a power-law degree distribution and is commonly used to study complex network dynamics.
ba_scale_free.gml.citation: Barabási, A.-L., & Albert, R. (1999). Emergence of Scaling in Random Networks. Science, 286(5439), 509–512.
